intro: Trimorpha neglecta, commonly known as the neglected tripleleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Trimorpha neglecta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
